abstract: Any S.E.C. investigation would not focus as much on the decision to use complex derivatives or whether the bank took on too much risk, but on when Jamie Dimon and the bank’s management knew about the losses, and what they said to investors about the problem.
snippet: Any S.E.C. investigation would not focus as much on the decision to use complex derivatives or whether the bank took on too much risk, but on when Jamie Dimon and the bank’s management knew about the losses, and what they said to investors about t...
lead_paragraph: Senator Everett Dirksen is reputed to have once said, “A billion here, a billion there, and pretty soon you’re talking real money.” JPMorgan Chase disclosed a $2 billion loss on a complex hedging strategy indeed qualifies as an object lesson for that axiom.

headline.main: JPMorgan’s Loss: Illegal, or Just Bad Judgment?

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: Dodd-Frank Wall Street Reform and Consumer Protection Act (2010)
